derivation: probably from the alternate of G2064 (ἐλεύθερος);
strongs_def: unrestrained (to go at pleasure), i.e. (as a citizen) not a slave (whether freeborn or manumitted), or (genitive case) exempt (from obligation or liability)
outline:
1. freeborn
    1. in a civil sense, one who is not a slave
    2. of one who ceases to be a slave, freed, manumitted
  2. free, exempt, unrestrained, not bound by an obligation
  3. in an ethical sense: free from the yoke of the Mosaic Law
